RT @SianieRoo: 2021 in ‘Great’ Britain, hailed as a developed country,one of the wealthiest in the world&with top scientists. 
And good old…

@ICOnews @EnvAgency I assume shall I that the ICO have written to the @EnvAgency following the First-Tier's ruling reminding them they must now comply with Mr Latimer's request?

And if not why not?
RT @ChrisGPackham: UPDATE - After the appeal we put out last night to @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup & @NESouthWest there was no nest…
@MarkAvery @WCL_News @EnvAgency Because it is grossly underfunded. Blame the government.
RT @SarahofScrubs: @ChrisGPackham @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest @WiseBirding Great news Chris - thank you as always. Sha…

@ChrisGPackham @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest @WiseBirding Amazing work @ChrisGPackham!
Please help us in our quest to stop @The_Blue_Cross  Lewknor being closed down for nothing more than a business decision.We’d love your opinion/help. Please help us! This is going to have a huge impact to the animals that Lewknor help. @savebxlewknor
RT @EnvAgency: The coarse fish close season has started. This means it’s illegal to fish for coarse fish in rivers until 15th June inclusiv…
RT @ChrisGPackham: UPDATE - After the appeal we put out last night to @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup & @NESouthWest there was no nest…

RT @Hillfortian: A joint statement from @ChilternsAONB & @BucksCouncil
on the potential damage - beyond the obvious- caused by boring massi…

@LKDevenish @ouramma @ExeterCouncil @DevonCC @EnvAgencySW Good point! Plus, this bank is very high up, closer to the road so perhaps it isn't flood-related...still, interested to know if this was deliberate/intentional.
@elldrews @EnvAgency Yes they the EA have approved it, they felt it did not require public consultation.

@Anna_Dillon @ChilternsAONB @BucksCouncil @EnvAgency @Feargal_Sharkey @AquiferChalk Therefore NONE of the models they are relying on as evidence of safe tunnelling are sound. garbage in, garbage out. First rule of modeling. There's insufficient data to be confident they won't disrupt the entire system. 
And don't get me started on all the other knock on effects!
RT @EnvAgency: The coarse fish close season has started. This means it’s illegal to fish for coarse fish in rivers until 15th June inclusiv…
@MarkAvery @WCL_News @EnvAgency Probably not.

@Anna_Dillon @ChilternsAONB @BucksCouncil @EnvAgency @Feargal_Sharkey @AquiferChalk It reminds me of the same stupidity that was circulating decades ago, when it was suggested that nuclear waste could be safely disposed of by firing it at the sun.  You shouldn't tamper with a natural system that isn't fully understood! We don't understand the aquifer fully.

@ChrisGPackham @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest @WiseBirding Keep up the great work Chris. Social media does have its positive side and this is yet another example of how to reach people and get things done! Fantastic as you might say 🤔

urls.title: The Chilterns AONB - News
urls.description: Buckinghamshire Council and the Chilterns Conservation Board have serious concerns about the impacts of HS2’s tunnelling operations on Buckinghamshire’s aquifer and chalk streams. These concerns relate to pollution resulting from tunnelling operations, increasing abstraction of water and impacts on the flow of significant chalk streams, such as the River Misbourne. A joint Position Statement has been issued with a series of questions regarding these concerns, and the Council and the Chilterns Conservation

text:
A joint statement from @ChilternsAONB & @BucksCouncil
on the potential damage - beyond the obvious- caused by boring massive holes in a fractured chalk geology. 
The questions raised here need serious address, not spin and rubber stamp approval @EnvAgency
https://t.co/kbOkQgUjAG https://t.co/zKTjm7TByN
RT @ChrisGPackham: UPDATE - After the appeal we put out last night to @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup & @NESouthWest there was no nest…
